properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 3:47AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
Note, a Winter Weather Advisory is in effect today and tonight for
elevations above 3500 feet in Watauga, Ashe, and Alleghany
counties in North Carolina as well as Grayson county in Virginia.
In these areas, snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, locally 5
inches, are expected for elevations above 3500 ft.

This Special Weather Statement covers areas of these same counties
below 3500 feet in elevation as well as Tazewell, Smyth, Bland,
and Wythe counties in southwest Virginia and Mercer county in
southeast West Virginia.

An upper-level disturbance, located in the Ohio Valley early this
morning, will track southeast across the region today. A period of
light snow is likely as this disturbance moves across the area.
Temperatures will remain mostly in the lower to mid 30s today
allowing for minor snow accumulations. While the main focus of
this disturbance will remain across eastern Tennessee and western
North Carolina, snow accumulations of 1-2 inches will be possible
in some areas, especially for elevations above 3000 ft. Locations
such as Burkes Garden could see upwards of 3 inches of snow.

If you plan to travel through this region today, be aware that
light snow is expected and could accumulate on untreated roads,
bridges, and overpasses. Be especially alert if planning to travel
on roads that pass through the higher elevations of the
mountains.
